> 
> RODIMUS PRIME drove through the different halls of the ARK, using the=

> its sensors as well as his own to locate the wayward WHEELIE,
> "WHEELIE=
! Where are you?" He called out as he zoomed in what he
> thought was his l=
ocatioons. "Wheelie!" He called again.
> 


As Rodimus located Wheelie, he =
would find the small bot over in the anterior bridge of the Ark.  Not where=
 the main battle had been of the boarding action so long ago, but over with=
in one of the secondary barracks units.

As Rodimus came in, he would see W=
heelie staring up silently over at a small plaque, upon which showed Cybert=
ron, and in the Autobot language of the era...  <Remembrance>

As Rodimus c=
ame on in, Wheelie quietly said, "I guess we know what we have to do.  We f=
ight for them, and for you.  We fight for what will come to be, but for the=
 past we cannot see."

Glancing oer at the bridge, where the bodies of thos=
e who would fight...  And those who would die, when things came to pass, "I=
s there any way to let them know?  When thier time will come to go?  The fu=
ture is at stake..  But have we not yet changed enough to remake?  To let t=
hem know when their time is due..  So they can make amends for you?  To per=
haps change what will come..  Have we not already done so much to overcome?=
  To those who will never get a cahnce to say goodbye..  Do we not owe it t=
o them to give a try?  But things have already been done enough.  We can't =
throw it off the cuff."
